title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 382.11 - Protection of the general population from releases of radioactivity
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 382.11 - Protection of the general population from releases of radioactivity

State Regulations

Concentrations of radioactive material which may be
released to the general environment in groundwater, surface water, air, soil, plants or animals must not result in an annual dose exceeding an equivalent of
25 millirems to the whole body, 75 millirems to the thyroid, and 25 millirems
to any other organ of any member of the public. Releases of radioactivity in
effluents to the general environment must be maintained as low as reasonably
achievable. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
382.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
